definition: to accelerate at full power (idiom); at full speed/fig. to work as hard as possible

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: He drove the police car at full throttle and dashed at the gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 他驾驶着警车开足马力向匪徒冲去。

sentences.english: China's own automakers are also revving up production.
sentences.chinese: 中国本土的汽车制造商也在开足马力提高产能。

sentences.english: Sprawling conglomerates are just as hard to manage as turbo-charged investment banks.
sentences.chinese: 任其发展的巨无霸就像开足马力的投行一样难以管理。

sentences.english: But, greatly small now steel ironworks production of put into high gear.
sentences.chinese: 但是，现在大大小小的钢铁厂又都开足马力生产。

definition: to go at full throttle/(fig.) to go all out/to kick into high gear
with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand
top speed/at full speed
to intensify/to speed up/to step up
to throw off inhibitions/to go all out
assembly line/production line
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
friendly one-upmanship/to try to emulate
bulldozer
to put into production/to put into operation
to race against time
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
